supercontext.mission: Document the 0.2.0 release encompassing GPT-5/Gemini 2.5 support, major UX overhaul, infrastructure improvements, and metadata fixes since initial 0.1.0 POC.

goal: Create comprehensive release notes documenting 10+ new features, critical fixes, and infrastructure improvements, bump version to 0.2.0, and prepare tagging instructions.
execution_instructions: Read CLAUDE.md and AGENTS.md for release workflow guardrails.
Do not implement features or refactors here—focus on documentation and versioning metadata.
If the working tree is dirty, resolve or document before proceeding.

steps: Run `git status` to ensure only intended files are touched.
Review existing release notes/CHANGELOG to determine the last published entry.

tasks.description: Summarize recent work using order index as source of truth.
steps: Create `CHANGELOG.md` in repo root following keepachangelog.com format with sections: Added (new features), Fixed (bug fixes), Changed (architectural changes), Infrastructure (tooling/processes).
Use docs/orders/README.md order index as authoritative source for completed orders since 0.1.0. Reference completion reports from docs/reports/ for evidence.
Review git log since 0.1.0 for additional features not captured in orders (commits: GPT-5, Gemini 2.5, UX overhaul, OpenRouter SDK migration, pre-commit hooks).
Add Planning section listing upcoming work from order index (duckdb-ingestion-001, model-catalog-v2-architecture-001).
Call out known limitations (Qwen QwQ 32B at 7/10 quality, speculative models pending validation).
Update `pyproject.toml` version from 0.1.0 to 0.2.0 (MINOR bump justified by 10+ new features with backward compatibility).
Note the rationale in CHANGELOG.md: 'Minor bump due to significant feature additions (GPT-5, Gemini 2.5, UX overhaul, pre-commit hooks) while maintaining backward compatibility.'
Verify no other files reference hardcoded version numbers that need updating.
Verify the working tree is clean aside from release note/version files.
Document tagging instructions (e.g., `git tag -a vX.Y.Z -m "Release notes"`).
List follow-on tasks (run metadata fix order, execute catalog implementation).

acceptance_criteria: Release notes reflect the metadata issues, architecture planning, and next steps.
Version in `pyproject.toml` is bumped with a documented rationale.
Tagging instructions are recorded and the working tree is clean.
Known limitations and upcoming work are clearly communicated.

what_not_to_do: Do not modify code apart from version strings.
Do not push tags/commits—provide instructions only.
Avoid editing unrelated documentation or configs unless required for the release entry.
constraints.escalation_guidance: If conflicting version numbers exist, document the discrepancy and pause the order for clarification.

testing.notes: Run full test suite to confirm repository health before 0.2.0 release. Use --quick flag to skip long-running performance benchmarks.
